txt.en:
'I believe it is time for us to part. The pain of my wound regresses, and I have gathered enough strength to walk for some distance. We will not remain safe here with the Orcs about, and I must find better shelter to protect my son. 

'Before we depart, it is worth noting that a Rohirrim scout from Cliving passed this way not long ago. He travelled south, searching for someone both savvy and skilled to help him with an important task. He requested my aid, but I explained that I would be more a hinderance than help to him.

'You have both the strength and courage to help others, perhaps you would be a more capable assistant to him. May fortune follow you, friend. I can never truly repay what you have done for us.'

'A hearty greeting to you, stranger! I have some rather important tasks that need carrying out, and I am in need of a savvy and skilled assistant. Before you decide, just know that it will be favourable for us both to work together.'
A Rohirrim scout approached Cyneswith looking for someone clever and strong to aid him. Cyneswith believes it would be best for someone in better condition than himself to help this man.
Talk to the Rohirrim scout looking for assistance
The Rohirrim Scout was seen heading south from the estate, across the river.\n\nCyneswith recommends speaking to the Rohirrim scout and inquiring as to what sort of aid he is seeking.
